generif.text: LINE-1 hypomethylation is significantly associated with CpG island hypermethylation in EF+ gastritis.
there was no significant association of LINE-1 methylation with case status, although reduced LINE-1 methylation was associated with increased risk of bladder cancer among never smokers
L1TD1 is a downstream target of Nanog and represents a useful marker for identifying undifferentiated hESC
L1TD1 is part of the L1TD1-RHA-LIN28 complex that could influence levels of OCT4, suggesting that L1TD1 has an important role in the regulation of stemness.
LINE-1 hypomethylation in gastric cancer is associated with shorter survival, suggesting that it has potential for use as a prognostic biomarker.

Paternal methylation aberrations at imprinting control regions of DLK1-GTL2, MEST (PEG1), and ZAC (PLAGL1) and global methylation levels are not associated with idiopathic recurrent spontaneous miscarriages.
LINE-1 methylation was evaluated, a statistical difference was seen amongst groups and a slight hypomethylated state in the AgP samples was observed.
L1TD1 may have become incorporated into pluripotency maintenance in some lineages.

we show that L1TD1 is a part of the pluripotency interactome network of OCT4, SOX2, and NANOG, bridging nuclear and cytoplasmic regulation and highlighting the importance of RNA biology in pluripotency.
L1TD1 depletion reduced medulloblastoma cell viability, cell proliferation, downregulated expression of the neural stem cell markers and induced apoptosis.

SPAG6 and L1TD1 are tumor-specifically methylated in NSCLCs and that DNA methylation is involved in the transcriptional regulation of these genes. Moreover, in vitro as well as in vivo experiments revealed tumor-cell growth suppressing properties of L1TD1 in NSCLC cells.
this study shows that LINE1 contributes to autoimmunity through both RIG-I- and MDA5-mediated RNA sensing pathways

The authors propose a model in which RNase H2 degrades the LINE-1 RNA after reverse transcription, allowing retrotransposition to be completed. This also explains how LINE-1 elements can retrotranspose efficiently without their own RNase H activity.
Study results identify increased expression of L1TD1 as a prognostic marker predicting longer disease-free survival in colon cancer patients.
Hepatitis C virus infection restricts human LINE-1 retrotransposition in hepatoma cells.
The Rhox gene cluster suppresses germline LINE1 transposition.
Structural dissection of sequence recognition and catalytic mechanism of human LINE-1 endonuclease.
Maternal LINE-1 DNA Methylation in Early Spontaneous Preterm Birth.
LINE-1 expression in cancer correlates with p53 mutation, copy number alteration, and S phase checkpoint.
MxB inhibits long interspersed element type 1 retrotransposition.
The differential expression of long interspersed nuclear elements-1 as a marker for hypomethylation in Merkel cell carcinoma.
LINE-1 hypomethylation is associated with poor outcomes in locoregionally advanced oropharyngeal cancer.
Identification and characterization of the long non-coding RNA NFIA-AS2 as a novel locus for body mass index in American Indians.
Dissolution of ribonucleoprotein condensates by the embryonic stem cell protein L1TD1.

name: LINE1 type transposase domain containing 1
summary: Predicted to enable single-stranded RNA binding activity. Predicted to be involved in transposition, RNA-mediated. Located in intracellular membrane-bounded organelle. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
